page.title: 10The Mary Stanford Disaster.
page.content: { On the 15th November 1928 }there was a call at Rye Harbour Lifeboat Station {The 'Alice',a steamer carrying {bricks,}was drifting {eight miles off {Dungeness.}It was a very stormy night and the steamer was taking in water.Launching the lifeboat was difficult.{There were 17 men in the {crew}and they had to wade in the water till there was a good depth for the boat to float.Soon after the launch a message reached the lifeboat station saying that {the crew of the Alice had {been rescued.}Flares were fired to recall the lifeboat but with no success. After several hours the Mary Stanford turned back, but a mile and a half from safety the boat was hit by a giant wave and overturned.{All 17 {lives were lost}and nearly every family in the Rye Harbour community suffered from the tragedy. {
